If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> be found <S%H4672><s%> stealing <S%H1589><s%> any <S%H5315><s%> of his brothers <S%H251><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> and makes merchandise <S%H6014><s%> of him, or sells <S%H4376><s%> him; then that thief <S%H1590><s%> shall die; <S%H4191><s%> and you shall put <S%H1197><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> away <S%H1197><s%> from among <S%H7130><s%> you.

Remember <S%H2142><s%> what <S%H853><s%> <S%H834><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> did <S%H6213><s%> to Miriam <S%H4813><s%> by the way, <S%H1870><s%> after that you were come <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> out of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

And if <S%H518><s%> the man <S%H376><s%> be poor, <S%H6041><s%> you shall not sleep <S%H7901><s%> with his pledge: <S%H5667><s%>

In any case <S%H7725><s%> you shall deliver <S%H7725><s%> him the pledge <S%H5667><s%> again <S%H7725><s%> when the sun <S%H8121><s%> goes <S%H935><s%> down, <S%H935><s%> that he may sleep <S%H7901><s%> in his own raiment, <S%H8008><s%> and bless <S%H1288><s%> you: and it shall be righteousness <S%H6666><s%> to you before <S%H6440><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God. <S%H430><s%>
